text: public school choice rsa is repealed and reenacted to read as follows chapter public school choice act definitions in this chapter department means the department of education parent means a parent guardian person having legal custody of a child or in the case of a child with a disability an educational surrogate parent who has been appointed in accordance with state or federal law public school choice means the ability of a parent to enroll their child in the public school or public academy of their choice pupil means any child who is at least years of age and not more than years of age who is eligible for attendance in public schools in new hampshire and who lives with a parent receiving district means the school of choice district in which a pupil enrolls resident district means the school district in which the pupil resides school board means the school district school board or board of trustees state board means the state board of education teacher means any individual providing direct instruction to pupils and who meets the requirements of the elementary and secondary education act of public law and the individuals with disabilities education act u s code chapter parental choice establishment pupils who are residents of this state shall be able to attend any public school public academy or program within new hampshire or in any state that has an interstate compact with new hampshire that does not require nonresident pupils to pay an application fee or tuition every school district shall adopt such policies and procedures as are reasonable and necessary to implement the provisions of this chapter including but not limited to time lines for application to and acceptance in any program or school which may provide for enrollment of the student on or before october the department shall make information available to the public about the enrollment options through the public school system admission and enrollment a parent may enroll their child in the public school or public academy of their choice without regard to residence or district boundaries a parent of pupil wishing to attend a public school shall submit an application to the receiving district the receiving district shall provide a copy of the application to the department no receiving district shall reject an application based upon grade or age levels pupil needs areas of academic focus aptitude academic or athletic achievement a receiving district may deny applications for the following reasons only a lack of space or capacity in the receiving school no receiving district shall be required to undertake space expansion to accommodate applying pupils b the pupil is under suspension or expulsion in the resident district if the number of applications exceeds the space or capacity of the requested school a waiting list shall be established from which students may be enrolled as space becomes available application decisions shall be made within school days by the receiving district the parent and the department shall be notified of the decision the parent may appeal a denied application to the state board in accordance with rsa implementation the department shall develop an application for enrollment in a school the state board of education shall adopt rules under to rsa relative to the procedures and guidelines necessary to effect the purposes of this chapter the receiving district shall not be required to provide transportation to public school choice pupils living outside the district boundaries the parent may provide transportation to a specific bus stop on an existing route of the receiving district pupils may apply for enrollment in a public school outside their resident school attendance area within the same school district funding the commissioner of the department of education shall apply for all federal funding available for public school choice per pupil adequate education grants shall be distributed under rsa plus any differentiated aid transfers shall be made in accordance with the distribution of adequate education grants under rsa the state education grants shall follow the pupil legal residence required amend rsa i to read as follows notwithstanding any other provision of law no person shall attend school or send a pupil to the school in any district in which the pupil is not a
